column1: On [[9 December]] [[1965]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to Jane Dixon''' of Ohio.<ref name=CG>{{CG

column1: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien is grateful for Dixon having sent him a copy of an article in the ''Saturday Review'' about the [[Ace Books]] edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. He also writes that neither he nor his publishers ([[Allen and Unwin
column2: George Allen and Unwin]]) intend to give [[The Walt Disney Company
column3: Walt Disney]] permission to make a film of his books.<ref name=CG/>

column1: *'''Publication:''' A description of the letter appeared in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column2: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''.
